projects.title: LYMA
projects.description:
Trusted with the task of introducing LYMA, a revolutionary luxury supplement, we took on the roles of designing its debut packaging, crafting its web presence, and establishing its distinctive brand identity. Despite facing various challenges, we managed to successfully deliver initial launch advertisements, innovative packaging designs, and compelling media content.
Headless Horse took charge of website design, curated social media content, and early packaging concepts, leading to prominent features in Vogue Paris, Harper's Bazaar, and Elle. Coined as 'the Bulgari of supplements' by The Evening Standard, our endeavours not only piqued global interest and captivated influential figures but also rapidly generated millions in startup value within a remarkably brief span of 12 months.

projects.title: TEAM DR JOSEPH
projects.description:
We collaborated with TEAM DR JOSEPH to create a sustainable and aligned identity. We developed a conscious packaging design that mirrors their commitment to quality skincare. We refined their branding and packaging while retaining core elements for recognition. The updated packaging boasts improved finishes, a new emblem, typography updates, and features like a recyclable wooden cap and domestically sourced FSC recycled paper.
A highlight is the flower design on the box. From Founder Erb. Dipl. Dr. Joseph Franz's 1986 herbarium collection, we scanned and embossed pressed flowers onto packaging.

projects.title: Tiffers
projects.description: Made to order and hand made in England, Tiffers is a luxury ready to wear millinery studio incorporating British ornithology. We were approached to deliver branding, stationary, website design and content as part of their 2023 launch.

projects.title: Nike Air Max Day
projects.description: This marble shoe was hand carved by Alasdair Thomson for Nike Air Max Day, 2017. Nike, the Greek goddess of victory, sister of Strength, Force and Zeal. Headless Horse delivered Nike Air Max, hand carved in white marble by sculptor, Alasdair Thomson. The Horsemen decided to celebrate Air Max Day 2017, with an immortal representation of grecian style, set in stone.

projects.title: Chanel No5
projects.description:
White Carrara marble, Chanel No5, bottle. Hand carved from marble, gilded with 24-carat gold leaf, and encased in a refurbished ammunition crate lined with crushed black velvet.
In memory of Robin Abbey 1948 - 2019.

projects.title: Karl Lagerfeld
projects.description: Immortalised in stone, the Horsemen remember the late Karl Lagerfeld.

projects.title: Nike Alpha Menace
projects.description: Explorations for the campaign of the Nike Alpha Menace, designed to put guys on skates. Inspiration was taken from anatomical sketches to convey the animalistic nature of the sole design.

projects.title: @pizza Edinburgh
projects.description: We were pleased to work @pizza again to design the artwork of their newest location in Edinburgh, on the famous Royal Mile. @pizza is a restaurant chain in the UK and we had previously worked with them to design the artwork of their Charlotte Lane, Edinburgh and Grand Central Station, Birmingham locations. The new Royal Mile site was formerly a Police Station, with its building spread over three floors. Headless Horse was briefed with delivering artwork to cover 9 elevations in total.

projects.title: @pizza Birmingham
projects.description: Creative Direction for the Interior Design of @pizza's Birmingham Grand Central Railway Station location. The lighting and the detailing on the panels was inspired by the railway tracks of the site's location. The lighting and tracks follow up from the floor over the ceiling and connects with a large neon sign of the brand's logo. Headless Horse was also responsible the artwork for the main interior wall.
